within OVN to stay one step behind, rendering the information within the
OVN DB inconsistent.

Related-Bug: #2038413

Change-Id: I59c6c4b2c8b023b9c9c3bab1741d957fa1f738fc
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2023-10-05 12:05:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/61a2fae7a1164c5fac2fde883b4c4ea59f965e44', 'message': '[OVN] Update lsp host id when virtual parent changes

When a virtual port is moved from one port to another port this event
will update the binding host id in the neutron database.
It then relied on the PortBindingChassisUpdateEvent to update the

However, the PortBindingChassisUpdateEvent is triggered simultaniously

Related-Bug: #2038413

Change-Id: I59c6c4b2c8b023b9c9c3bab1741d957fa1f738fc
'}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2023-10-24 13:47:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/0a1c563ea5ccd47af2cd2ed637117e29f9077196', 'message': "[OVN] Update lsp host id when virtual parent moves

When a virtual port is moved from one port to another port the
PortBindingUpdateVirtualPortsEvent event would only update the binding
host id in the neutron database, while it is also usefull to keep the
information in the OVN database up to date with the host information

Other plugins that connect to the OVN database can then also rely on the
information stored in the OVN DB's


Related-Bug: #2038413

Change-Id: I59c6c4b2c8b023b9c9c3bab1741d957fa1f738fc

host id in the neutron database, while it is also usefull to keep the
information in the OVN database up to date with the host information

Other plugins that connect to the OVN database can then also rely on the
information stored in the OVN DB's


Closes-Bug: #2038413

Change-Id: I59c6c4b2c8b023b9c9c3bab1741d957fa1f738fc
"}]
commit_message:
[OVN] Update lsp host id when virtual parent moves

When a virtual port is moved from one port to another port the
PortBindingUpdateVirtualPortsEvent event would only update the binding
host id in the neutron database, while it is also usefull to keep the
information in the OVN database up to date with the host information

Other plugins that connect to the OVN database can then also rely on the
information stored in the OVN DB's


Closes-Bug: #2038413

Change-Id: I59c6c4b2c8b023b9c9c3bab1741d957fa1f738fc

commit_message:
Modernize the swift role

Swift role is still using the old format today. and the refactor
task was delayed for several cycles.
This commit refactors the swift role and keeps the privious logic.

Closes-Bug: #1842637
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/722798

Change-Id: Idd975f5f1dd7fb95fe921f660e8ef32a570932f3

commit_message:
add functional repoducer for bug 2048837

Change-Id: I8ce3044cff198209416d2a458317f01d1177e9da
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/79/919979/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import fixtures import threading from unittest import mock from nova.tests.functional.libvirt import base from nova.virt import libvirt class TestConcurrentMultiAttachCleanup(base.ServersTestBase): """Regression test for bug 2048837. This regression test aims to assert that if a multi attached volume is attached to two vms on the same host and both are deleted the volume is correctly cleaned up. Nova historically did not guard the critical section where concurrent delete determined if they were the last user of a the host mounted multi attach volume. As a result its possible for both delete to believe the other would call disconnect and the volume can be leaked. see https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/2048837 for details """ microversion = 'latest' CAST_AS_CALL = False REQUIRES_LOCKING = True def setUp(self): super().setUp() self._orgi_should_disconnect = ( libvirt.LibvirtDriver._should_disconnect_target) self.should_disconnect_mock = self.useFixture(fixtures.MockPatch( 'nova.virt.libvirt.LibvirtDriver._should_disconnect_target', mock.Mock(side_effect=self._should_disconnect))).mock self.disconnect_volume_mock = self.useFixture(fixtures.MockPatch( 'nova.virt.libvirt.volume.volume.' 'LibvirtFakeVolumeDriver.disconnect_volume', mock.Mock())).mock hostname = self.start_compute() self.compute_manager = self.computes[hostname] self.volume_id = self.cinder.MULTIATTACH_VOL # Launch a server and attach a volume self.server_a = self._create_server(networks='none') self._wait_for_state_change(self.server_a, 'ACTIVE') self._attach_volume(self.server_a, self.volume_id) # Launch a second server and attempt to attach the same volume again self.server_b = self._create_server(networks='none') self._wait_for_state_change(self.server_b, 'ACTIVE') self._attach_volume(self.server_b, self.volume_id) self.lock = threading.Lock() def _should_disconnect(self, *args, **kwargs): with self.lock: result = self._orgi_should_disconnect( self.compute_manager.driver, *args, **kwargs) return result def test_serial_server_delete(self): # Now that we have 2 vms both using the same multi attach volume # we can delete the volumes serial and confirm that we are cleaning up self.should_disconnect_mock.assert_not_called() self.disconnect_volume_mock.assert_not_called() self._delete_server(self.server_a) self.should_disconnect_mock.assert_called() self.disconnect_volume_mock.assert_not_called() self._delete_server(self.server_b) self.disconnect_volume_mock.assert_called() def test_concurrent_server_delete(self): # Now that we have 2 vms both using the same multi attach volume # we can delete the volumes concurrently and confirm that we are # cleaning up self.should_disconnect_mock.assert_not_called() self.disconnect_volume_mock.assert_not_called() self.lock.acquire() self.api.delete_server(self.server_a['id']) self.disconnect_volume_mock.assert_not_called() self.api.delete_server(self.server_b['id']) self.disconnect_volume_mock.assert_not_called() self.lock.release() self._wait_until_deleted(self.server_a) self._wait_until_deleted(self.server_b) self.should_disconnect_mock.assert_called() # Fixme(sean-k-mooney): this is bug 2048837 self.disconnect_volume_mock.assert_not_called()

subject: WIP: udevadm settle: Wait for multipath device for I/O
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2024-05-27 19:17:13.000000000', 'files': ['os_brick/initiator/connectors/fibre_channel.py', 'os_brick/initiator/connectors/iscsi.py', 'os_brick/initiator/linuxscsi.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-brick/commit/9ccaa6cec53c5eb2fdd3ab1a962177b06b10cd0b', 'message': 'WIP: udevadm settle: Wait for multipath device for I/O

There can be race conditions when the multipath device is not ready
for writing but we attempt to write to it causing failures.
This can be resolved by waiting for udev events to finish on the
device before performing I/O.
This patch implements udevadm settle call for such a case.

Change-Id: Ic95d20b623462964de23190f0361df0b715ad554
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: udevadm settle: Wait for multipath device for I/O

There can be race conditions when the multipath device is not ready
for writing but we attempt to write to it causing failures.
This can be resolved by waiting for udev events to finish on the
device before performing I/O.
This patch implements udevadm settle call for such a case.

Change-Id: Ic95d20b623462964de23190f0361df0b715ad554
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-brick refs/changes/88/920588/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def udevadm_settle(self, wwid): """Wait for multipath device to become ready for I/O. WWID is the multipath device or the SCSI ID/WWID of the device. """ path = '/dev/disk/by-id/dm-uuid-mpath-' + wwid try: (out, _err) = self._execute('udevadm', 'settle', '-E', path, run_as_root=True, root_helper=self._root_helper) except putils.ProcessExecutionError as exc: LOG.warning("udevadm call failed exit %(code)s", {'code': exc.exit_code}) raise exception.CommandExecutionFailed( cmd='udevadm settle -E %s' % path)

commit_message:
Fix mounting in test_instances_with_cinder_volumes

Fix mount path conflict by ensuring it's unmounted before mounting
new device

Change-Id: Ib5143151ae1df67115053c1e6dada0c05b760b3b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/88/920988/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # check if directory to which we want to mount volume is free # if not, we need to unmount it first check_mount_cmd = f"mount | grep {mount_path}" try: self.linux_client.exec_command(check_mount_cmd) # If the directory is already mounted, unmount it unmount_cmd = f"sudo umount {mount_path}" self.linux_client.exec_command(unmount_cmd) except exceptions.SSHExecCommandFailed: # Directory is not mounted, continue pass

commit_message:
Support wrapped release names

Charm instances where the release is > zed does not work using the
default_get_charm_instance. The keys stored in the _releases dictionary
are sorted in their alphabetical sorting order, thus causing releases
such as Bobcat to be treated as older releases than Zed.

This change causes the release names to be sorted using the
CompareOpenStackReleases object from the charmhelpers library. This will
ensure that the release names are sorted according the release order
rather than the alphabetical name.

Change-Id: I528a9dcc5511b74186132b57948e18e4f3a1ef0b
(cherry picked from commit 760f1257ef11a53e2491fda91ebf6454c1182ad3)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charms.openstack refs/changes/11/921011/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'train', 'ussuri', 'victoria', 'wallaby', 'xena', 'yoga', 'zed', 'antelope', 'bobcat', 'caracal',class CompareOpenStackReleases(object): # This class is included due to mocking out the charmhelpers libraries # as they behave poorly with apt installs. _list = charmhelpers.contrib.openstack.utils.OPENSTACK_RELEASES def __init__(self, item): if self._list is None: raise Exception("Must define the _list in the class definition!") try: self.index = self._list.index(item) except Exception: raise KeyError("Item '{}' is not in list '{}'" .format(item, self._list)) def __eq__(self, other): assert isinstance(other, str) or isinstance(other, self.__class__) return self.index == self._list.index(other) def __ne__(self, other): return not self.__eq__(other) def __lt__(self, other): assert isinstance(other, str) or isinstance(other, self.__class__) return self.index < self._list.index(other) def __ge__(self, other): return not self.__lt__(other) def __gt__(self, other): assert isinstance(other, str) or isinstance(other, self.__class__) return self.index > self._list.index(other) def __le__(self, other): return not self.__gt__(other) def __str__(self): """Always give back the item at the index so it can be used in comparisons like: s_mitaka = CompareOpenStack('mitaka') s_newton = CompareOpenstack('newton') assert s_newton > s_mitaka @returns: <string> """ return self._list[self.index] charmhelpers.contrib.openstack.utils.CompareOpenStackReleases = \ CompareOpenStackReleases

commit_message:
Remove pysendfile

The library has been unmaintained and no release was created since
2014. It was used by glance but the implementation has been broken and
was removed.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/glance/+/916422
Change-Id: I5ac18b783c3ef48015f18e0107c90de4c500aa89

commit_message:
Use new sort method _sort_releases to support wrapped release names

Earlier trilio module was using sorted method to sort supported openstack releases,
but this method was causing issue for zed and yoga release and was considering antelope only.
With this change we are going to use the new method from core module _sort_releases which correctly handles
the situation.

Change-Id: I340d3b646d2472e751d01e2bf786ada7b19cbd3d
(cherry picked from commit 5f56d452158ce8c66846c8d8141a25a0f120effa)

image if the image wasn't one that was

This fix does two things:

commit_message:
Fix DockerWorker image removal

When DockerWorker was called to remove
an image, it would fail silently to remove
image if the image wasn't one that was
in-use by the deployed containers.
This fix does two things:
- enables removal of any docker image
  on host
- returns changed=false when removal of
  non-existent image is called

Change-Id: I09c570b30897e2d0187f751cdc94b6be6ff084d9
Signed-off-by: Roman Krček <roman.krcek@tietoevry.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/43/921643/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: |- When DockerWorker was called to remove an image, it would fail silently to remove image if the image wasn't one that was in-use by the deployed containers. This fix does two things: - enables removal of any docker image on host - returns changed=false when removal of non-existent image is called

commit_message:
Automate prometheus blackbox configuration

This change automates the prometheus blackbox monitoring configuration
for common endpoints. Custom endpoints can be added to
prometheus_blackbox_exporter_endpoints_custom.

Change-Id: Id6f51a2bebee3ab63b84ca7032aad17c2933838c

added_lines: # prometheus_blackbox_exporter_endpoints_custom: # - 'custom_services:os_endpoint:{{ external_protocol }}://{{ glance_external_fqdn | # put_address_in_context('url') }}:{{ custom_serivce_port }}'# For a list of default endpoints see # prometheus_blackbox_exporter_endpoints_default.prometheus_blackbox_exporter_endpoints_custom: [] prometheus_blackbox_exporter_endpoints_default: - endpoints: - "neutron:os_endpoint:{{ public_protocol }}://{{ neutron_external_fqdn | put_address_in_context('url') }}:{{ neutron_server_public_port }}" - "neutron_internal:os_endpoint:{{ internal_protocol }}://{{ neutron_internal_fqdn | put_address_in_context('url') }}:{{ neutron_server_port }}" enabled: "{{ enable_neutron }}" - endpoints: - "nova:os_endpoint:{{ public_protocol }}://{{ nova_external_fqdn | put_address_in_context('url') }}:{{ nova_api_public_port }}" - "nova_internal:os_endpoint:{{ internal_protocol }}://{{ nova_internal_fqdn | put_address_in_context('url') }}:{{ nova_api_port }}" enabled: "{{ enable_nova }}" - endpoints: "{% for host in groups.get('etcd', []) %}etcd_{{ host }}:http_2xx:{{ etcd_protocol }}://{{ 'api' | kolla_address(host) | put_address_in_context('url') }}:{{ hostvars[host]['etcd_client_port'] }}{% if not loop.last %},{% endif %}{% endfor %}" enabled: "{{ enable_etcd }}" prometheus_blackbox_exporter_endpoints: "{{ prometheus_blackbox_exporter_endpoints_default | selectattr('enabled') | map(attribute='endpoints') | flatten | union(prometheus_blackbox_exporter_endpoints_custom) | unique }}"

commit_message:
Add conntrackd support to HA routers in L3 agent

Currently active sessions which need connection tracking state are
broken by a HA router failover. There is no mechanism to synchronize
states between HA router instances.

This patch adds conntrackd support to enable state synchronization.

An example about using conntrackd with keepalived can be found here:
http://backreference.org/2013/04/03/firewall-ha-with-conntrackd-and-keepalived

Co-Authored-By: QthCN <tianhuan@unitedstack.com>

Change-Id: I28fb57b87c0e7113416873f602fcbce3742b3aaa
Closes-Bug: #1365438
Original-Change-Id: Ifc95d5fd17ae8a13958d97796b1046f35bd7aca7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/30/917430/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2015 UnitedStack, Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import os import signal import stat import jinja2 from neutron_lib.utils import file as file_utils from oslo_config import cfg from oslo_log import log as logging from oslo_utils.fileutils import ensure_tree from neutron._i18n import _ from neutron.agent.linux import external_process from neutron.agent.linux import utils from neutron.common import utils as common_utils CONNTRACKD_SERVICE_NAME = 'conntrackd' SIGTERM_TIMEOUT = 5 LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) CONFIG_TEMPLATE = jinja2.Template( """ General { HashSize {{ hash_size }} HashLimit {{ hash_limit }} Syslog on LockFile {{ lockfile_path }} UNIX { Path {{ socket_path }} Backlog {{ unix_backlog }} } SocketBufferSize {{ socket_buffer_size }} SocketBufferSizeMaxGrown {{ socket_buffer_size_max_grown }} Filter From Kernelspace { Protocol Accept { {%- for proto in protocol_accept %} {{ proto }} {%- endfor %} } Address Ignore { {%- for version, addr in address_ignore %} IPv{{ version }}_address {{ addr }} {%- endfor %} } } } Sync { Mode FTFW { } Multicast Default { IPv4_address {{ ipv4_mcast_addr }} IPv4_interface {{ ipv4_interface }} Group {{ mcast_group }} Interface {{ interface }} SndSocketBuffer {{ snd_socket_buffer }} RcvSocketBuffer {{ rcv_socket_buffer }} Checksum on } } """) HA_SCRIPT_TEMPLATE = jinja2.Template( """#!/bin/sh # # (C) 2006-2011 by Pablo Neira Ayuso <pablo@netfilter.org> # # This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify # it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by # the Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of the License, or # (at your option) any later version. # # Description: # # This is the script for primary-backup setups for keepalived # (http://www.keepalived.org). You may adapt it to make it work with other # high-availability managers. # # Do not forget to include the required modifications to your keepalived.conf # file to invoke this script during keepalived's state transitions. # # Contributions to improve this script are welcome :). # CONNTRACKD_BIN=/usr/sbin/conntrackd CONNTRACKD_LOCK={{ lock }} CONNTRACKD_CONFIG={{ config }} case "$1" in primary) # # commit the external cache into the kernel table # $CONNTRACKD_BIN -C $CONNTRACKD_CONFIG -c if [ $? -eq 1 ] then logger "ERROR: failed to invoke conntrackd -c" fi # # flush the internal and the external caches # $CONNTRACKD_BIN -C $CONNTRACKD_CONFIG -f if [ $? -eq 1 ] then logger "ERROR: failed to invoke conntrackd -f" fi # # resynchronize my internal cache to the kernel table # $CONNTRACKD_BIN -C $CONNTRACKD_CONFIG -R if [ $? -eq 1 ] then logger "ERROR: failed to invoke conntrackd -R" fi # # send a bulk update to backups # $CONNTRACKD_BIN -C $CONNTRACKD_CONFIG -B if [ $? -eq 1 ] then logger "ERROR: failed to invoke conntrackd -B" fi ;; backup) # # is conntrackd running? request some statistics to check it # $CONNTRACKD_BIN -C $CONNTRACKD_CONFIG -s if [ $? -eq 1 ] then # # something's wrong, do we have a lock file? # if [ -f $CONNTRACKD_LOCK ] then logger "WARNING: conntrackd was not cleanly stopped." logger "If you suspect that it has crashed:" logger "1) Enable coredumps" logger "2) Try to reproduce the problem" logger "3) Post the coredump to netfilter-devel@vger.kernel.org" rm -f $CONNTRACKD_LOCK fi $CONNTRACKD_BIN -C $CONNTRACKD_CONFIG -d if [ $? -eq 1 ] then logger "ERROR: cannot launch conntrackd" exit 1 fi fi # # shorten kernel conntrack timers to remove the zombie entries. # $CONNTRACKD_BIN -C $CONNTRACKD_CONFIG -t if [ $? -eq 1 ] then logger "ERROR: failed to invoke conntrackd -t" fi # # request resynchronization with master firewall replica (if any) # Note: this does nothing in the alarm approach. # $CONNTRACKD_BIN -C $CONNTRACKD_CONFIG -n if [ $? -eq 1 ] then logger "ERROR: failed to invoke conntrackd -n" fi ;; fault) # # shorten kernel conntrack timers to remove the zombie entries. # $CONNTRACKD_BIN -C $CONNTRACKD_CONFIG -t if [ $? -eq 1 ] then logger "ERROR: failed to invoke conntrackd -t" fi ;; *) logger "ERROR: unknown state transition" echo "Usage: primary-backup.sh {primary|backup|fault}" exit 1 ;; esac exit 0 """) class ConntrackdManager(object): """Wrapper for conntrackd. This wrapper permits to write conntrackd config file, to start/restart conntrackd process. """ def __init__(self, resource_id, process_monitor, agent_conf, mcast_iface_addr, ha_vr_id, ha_iface, namespace=None): self.resource_id = resource_id self.process_monitor = process_monitor self.agent_conf = agent_conf self.mcast_iface_addr = mcast_iface_addr self.ha_vr_id = ha_vr_id self.ha_iface = ha_iface self.namespace = namespace def build_ha_script(self): ha_script_content = HA_SCRIPT_TEMPLATE.render( lock=self.get_lockfile_path(), config=self.get_conffile_path(), ) ha_script_path = self.get_ha_script_path() file_utils.replace_file(ha_script_path, ha_script_content) os.chmod(ha_script_path, stat.S_IRUSR | stat.S_IWUSR | stat.S_IXUSR) def get_full_config_file_path(self, filename, maxlen=255): # Maximum PATH lenght for most paths in conntrackd is limited to # 255 characters. conf_dir = self.get_conf_dir() ensure_tree(conf_dir, 0o755) path = os.path.join(conf_dir, filename) if len(path) > maxlen: raise ValueError(_('Configuration file path "%(path)s" exceeds ' 'maximum length of %(maxlen)i characters.') % {'path': path, 'maxlen': maxlen}) return path def get_conf_dir(self): confs_dir = os.path.abspath( os.path.normpath(self.agent_conf.ha_confs_path)) conf_dir = os.path.join(confs_dir, self.resource_id) return conf_dir def get_ha_script_path(self): return self.get_full_config_file_path('primary-backup.sh') def get_pid_file_path(self): return self.get_full_config_file_path('conntrackd.pid') def get_lockfile_path(self): return self.get_full_config_file_path('conntrackd.lock') def get_ctlfile_path(self): # Unix socket path length is limited to 107 characters in the # conntrackd source code. See UNIX_PATH_MAX constant in include/local.h return self.get_full_config_file_path('conntrackd.ctl', maxlen=107) def get_conffile_path(self): return self.get_full_config_file_path('conntrackd.conf') def create_pid_file(self): config_path = self.get_conffile_path() pid_file = self.get_pid_file_path() cmd = 'conntrackd -d -C %s' % config_path pids = utils.find_pids_by_cmd(cmd) if pids: pid = pids[0] file_utils.replace_file(pid_file, pid) else: raise RuntimeError(_('No conntrackd process found.')) def spawn(self): config_path = self.output_config_file() self.build_ha_script() def callback(pidfile): cmd = ['conntrackd', '-d', '-C', config_path] return cmd def pre_cmd_callback(): # conntrackd.lock and conntrackd.ctl must be removed before # starting a new conntrackd. utils.delete_if_exists(self.get_lockfile_path(), run_as_root=True) utils.delete_if_exists(self.get_ctlfile_path(), run_as_root=True) def post_cmd_callback(): self.create_pid_file() # Synchronize connection tracking state with peer cmd = ['conntrackd', '-C', config_path, '-n'] utils.execute(cmd, run_as_root=True, check_exit_code=True) pm = self.get_process(callback=callback, pre_cmd_callback=pre_cmd_callback, post_cmd_callback=post_cmd_callback) pm.enable(reload_cfg=False) self.create_pid_file() self.process_monitor.register(uuid=self.resource_id, service_name=CONNTRACKD_SERVICE_NAME, monitored_process=pm) LOG.debug('Conntrackd spawned with config %s', config_path) def get_process(self, callback=None, pre_cmd_callback=None, post_cmd_callback=None): return external_process.ProcessManager( cfg.CONF, self.resource_id, self.namespace, default_cmd_callback=callback, default_pre_cmd_callback=pre_cmd_callback, default_post_cmd_callback=post_cmd_callback, pid_file=self.get_pid_file_path()) def disable(self): self.process_monitor.unregister(uuid=self.resource_id, service_name=CONNTRACKD_SERVICE_NAME) pm = self.get_process() if not pm.active: return # First try to stop conntrackd by using it's own control command config_path = self.get_conffile_path() cmd = ['conntrackd', '-C', config_path, '-k'] utils.execute(cmd, run_as_root=True) try: common_utils.wait_until_true(lambda: not pm.active, timeout=SIGTERM_TIMEOUT) except common_utils.WaitTimeout: LOG.warning('Conntrackd process %s did not finish after asking it ' 'to shut down in %s seconds, sending SIGKILL signal.', pm.pid, SIGTERM_TIMEOUT) pm.disable(sig=str(int(signal.SIGKILL))) def build_config(self): return CONFIG_TEMPLATE.render( hash_size=self.agent_conf.ha_conntrackd_hashsize, hash_limit=self.agent_conf.ha_conntrackd_hashlimit, lockfile_path=self.get_lockfile_path(), socket_path=self.get_ctlfile_path(), unix_backlog=self.agent_conf.ha_conntrackd_unix_backlog, socket_buffer_size=self.agent_conf.ha_conntrackd_socketbuffersize, socket_buffer_size_max_grown=( self.agent_conf.ha_conntrackd_socketbuffersize_max_grown ), protocol_accept=[ 'TCP', 'SCTP', 'DCCP', 'UDP', 'ICMP', 'IPv6-ICMP' ], # Ignore loopback and HA sync addresses address_ignore=[ (4, '127.0.0.1'), (6, '::1'), (4, self.mcast_iface_addr), ], ipv4_mcast_addr=self.agent_conf.ha_conntrackd_ipv4_mcast_addr, ipv4_interface=self.mcast_iface_addr, mcast_group=self.agent_conf.ha_conntrackd_group + self.ha_vr_id, interface=self.ha_iface, snd_socket_buffer=self.agent_conf.ha_conntrackd_sndsocketbuffer, rcv_socket_buffer=self.agent_conf.ha_conntrackd_rcvsocketbuffer, ) def output_config_file(self): config_path = self.get_conffile_path() file_utils.replace_file(config_path, self.build_config()) return config_path

commit_message:
Remove tenant_id from the security group default rules definition

Default security group rules are not really API resources which belongs
to any of the projects, they are 'global' thing configured by admin for
all projects in Neutron but because of the bug related to this patch its
API definition had to have tenant_id listed as one of the parameters.

Now, once this bug is fixed in neutron-lib with [1] tenant_id can be
removed from the definiton of the default security group rules.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-lib/+/919588

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-lib/+/919588

Related-Bug: #2022043
Change-Id: I851c324b274ed5689a99c49a252787bf99375449
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/65/919665/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Refactor of kolla_container_facts

Refactor that prepares kolla_container_facts
module for introducing more actions that will be moved
from kolla_container module and kolla_container_volume_facts.

This change is based on a discussion about adding a new action
to kolla_container module that retrieves all names of the running
containers. It was agreed that kolla-ansible should follow Ansible's
direction of splitting modules between action modules and facts
modules. Because of this, kolla_container_facts needs to be able
to handle different requests for data about containers or volumes.

Change-Id: Ieaec8f64922e4e5a2199db2d6983518b124cb4aa
Signed-off-by: Ivan Halomi <ivan.halomi@tietoevry.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/17/911417/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: action: get_containers

commit_message:
Add the field "rbac_actions" to the model query hooks

This patch adds a new field to the models query hook: "rbac_actions".
This field stores the multiple RBAC actions to filter the query in
case of making a non-admin query.

The default RBAC action are "access_as_shared" and "access_as_readonly".
For networks and subnets, the action "access_as_external" is needed in
this query. Instead of adding a query hook, this additional field allows
to modify the required RBAC action filter.

Related-Bug: #2059236
Change-Id: Ic41461223719c535ac9d2bbadfb1b6077c898903
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib refs/changes/73/914473/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from collections import abc DEFAULT_RBAC_ACTIONS = {constants.ACCESS_SHARED, constants.ACCESS_READONLY, } result_filters=None, rbac_actions=None): to callables performing the hook or in the case of ``rbac_actions``, a set of RBAC actions to filter the model. :param rbac_actions: An iterable of RBAC actions or a single one (string). if rbac_actions is not None: if isinstance(rbac_actions, abc.Iterable): rbac_actions = set(rbac_actions) else: rbac_actions = {rbac_actions} 'result_filters': result_filters, 'rbac_actions': rbac_actions,def get_rbac_actions(model): """Retrieve and combine all RBAC actions requested in a model :param model: The DB Model to look up for query hooks. :returns: A set of RBAC actions defined in the model or the default RBAC actions ('access_as_shared', 'access_as_readonly') """ rbac_actions = None for hook in get_hooks(model): hook_rbac_actions = hook.get('rbac_actions') if hook_rbac_actions is not None: if rbac_actions is None: rbac_actions = set() rbac_actions.update(hook_rbac_actions) return rbac_actions if rbac_actions is not None else DEFAULT_RBAC_ACTIONS (rbac_model.action.in_(get_rbac_actions(model)) &
deleted_lines: result_filters=None): to callables performing the hook. 'result_filters': result_filters (rbac_model.action.in_( [constants.ACCESS_SHARED, constants.ACCESS_READONLY]) &

https://lists.openstack.org/archives/list/openstack-discuss@lists.openstack.org/thread/HVFN5RBSHRTM3B2UUKPAWKH6H6AT6CYR/

and the commit message of the keystone patch:
https://review.opendev.org/c/899519

commit_message:
Support rescue with ephemeral encryption for qcow2

This also makes rescue use the image metadata from the
CONF.libvirt.rescue_image_id if it ends up being chosen as the rescue
image. Previously, its image metadata was never used.

Related to blueprint ephemeral-encryption-libvirt

Change-Id: I254eb563f90772d3a2273c4286142f6a761285df
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/75/873675/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(melwitt): A legacy rescue only provides the rescue device # and the original root device, but we still need to provide # block_device_info to the get_disk_info call because the disk # might be encrypted.
deleted_lines: # NOTE(lyarwood): A legacy rescue only provides the rescue device # and the original root device so we don't need to provide # block_device_info to the get_disk_info call. block_device_info = None

subject: libvirt: Introduce support for raw with LUKS

commit_message:
libvirt: Introduce support for raw with LUKS

This adds ephemeral encryption support for the raw image backend.

Part of blueprint ephemeral-encryption-libvirt

Change-Id: I64f6a71d292be1074a1d3a8d3578a3bccafab475
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/13/884313/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: SUPPORTS_LUKS = True # 'luks' is not a valid block driver format despite it being the # disk image file format. For example, this XML raises an error: # # <disk type="file" device="disk"> # <driver name="qemu" type="luks" cache="none"/> # # libvirt.libvirtError: unsupported configuration: unknown driver # format value 'luks' # # Return format 'raw' in this case. return data.file_format if data.file_format != 'luks' else 'raw' # FIXME(lyarwood): Context is provided as a kwarg here thanks to # the legacy ephemeral encryption implementation. It should likely # be an arg but the required refactor isn't trivial. context = kwargs.get('context') encryption = self.get_encryption(context) if not encryption: libvirt_utils.copy_image(base, target) else: images.convert_image( base, target, self.driver_format, encryption.get('format'), dest_encryption=encryption, ) if size: self.resize_image(size, encryption=encryption) prepare_template( target=self.path, encryption=encryption, *args, **kwargs) self.resize_image(size, encryption=encryption) disk.extend(image, size, encryption=encryption) images.convert_image( self.path, target, self.driver_format, out_format, encryption=encryption, )
deleted_lines: return data.file_format libvirt_utils.copy_image(base, target) if size: self.resize_image(size) prepare_template(target=self.path, *args, **kwargs) self.resize_image(size) disk.extend(image, size) images.convert_image(self.path, target, self.driver_format, out_format)

commit_message:
Resolve B113 error (Requests call without timeout)

Add tunable timeout options to all request calls, so that slow response
does not hung up heat.

Change-Id: I16911cfe8e47f74f758103090bcba27b1750a350
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/41/914741/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cfg.FloatOpt('timeout', default=60, min=0, help=_('Timeout in seconds for HTTP requests.')), cert=self.ssl_options['cert'], timeout=self._conf_get('timeout'))

Change variables for inclusive naming

Change the variables used for allowing/denying certain plugins
to follow inclusive naming guidelines.

Change-Id: Ia47b6ea0f01738cec1a4c21e1cd3d2e3174ac3e2

added_lines: svc_plugin_denylist = [ mech_driver_allowlist = ['sriovnicswitch'] The ``svc_plugin_denylist`` class variable defines which if service_plugin not in self.svc_plugin_denylist The ``mech_driver_allowlist`` class variable defines which if mech_driver in self.mech_driver_allowlist
deleted_lines: svc_plugin_blacklist = [ mech_driver_whitelist = ['sriovnicswitch'] The ``svc_plugin_blacklist`` class variable defines which if service_plugin not in self.svc_plugin_blacklist The ``mech_driver_whitelist`` class variable defines which if mech_driver in self.mech_driver_whitelist

subject: Quota --no-force/--check-limit as default
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2024-05-06 11:54:08.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/common/quota.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient/commit/b837a36bd7f217e48d014080b9f4f3dd6bd8cab6', 'message': "Quota --no-force/--check-limit as default

As requested in [1], the default behavior should be when quota set
amount bigger than existing resource count, do not set.

This makes sense for most resource use cases, for other cases when
override is needed, then '--force' option can override default.

[1]
https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1936408
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1977719

Change-Id: Ibb1f7267fd12fb1e802fab44f76f34910072a988
"}]
commit_message:
Quota --no-force/--check-limit as default

As requested in [1], the default behavior should be when quota set
amount bigger than existing resource count, do not set.

This makes sense for most resource use cases, for other cases when
override is needed, then '--force' option can override default.

[1]
https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1936408
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1977719

Change-Id: Ibb1f7267fd12fb1e802fab44f76f34910072a988
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/08/918308/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: default=True, '(default)' "This command currently defaults to '--no-force' when modifying " "network quotas, amount set when bigger than resource count. " "Consider explicitly providing '--force' when needed."
deleted_lines: # TODO(stephenfin): Change the default to False in Z or later default=None, '(default for compute)' "This command currently defaults to '--force' when modifying " "network quotas. This behavior will change in a future " "release. Consider explicitly providing '--force' or " "'--no-force' options to avoid changes in behavior."

Related to blueprint ephemeral-storage-encryption

added_lines: def snapshot_extract(self, target, out_format, encryption=None): def snapshot_extract(self, target, out_format, encryption=None): # If we are fetching the base image, it is possible we will need to # convert it to raw if it is not already in raw format. If we do # and if the image is encrypted, we will need the encryption secret # for the image in order to convert it. image_encryption = None image_encryption_secret_uuid = kwargs.pop( 'image_encryption_secret_uuid', None) if image_encryption_secret_uuid: secret = self.key_manager.get( context, image_encryption_secret_uuid).get_encoded() image_encryption = {'secret': secret} prepare_template( target=base, encryption=image_encryption, *args, **kwargs) def snapshot_extract(self, target, out_format, encryption=None, dest_encryption=None): print(f'ENCRYPTION = {encryption}') out_format, encryption=encryption, dest_encryption=dest_encryption) def snapshot_extract(self, context, target, out_format, encryption=None): def snapshot_extract(self, context, target, out_format, encryption=None): def snapshot_extract(self, context, target, out_format, encryption=None): def by_libvirt_path( self, instance, path, image_type=None, disk_info_mapping=None ): return backend( instance=instance, path=path, disk_info_mapping=disk_info_mapping)
deleted_lines: def snapshot_extract(self, target, out_format): def snapshot_extract(self, target, out_format): prepare_template(target=base, *args, **kwargs) def snapshot_extract(self, target, out_format): out_format) def snapshot_extract(self, target, out_format): def snapshot_extract(self, target, out_format): def snapshot_extract(self, target, out_format): def by_libvirt_path(self, instance, path, image_type=None): return backend(instance=instance, path=path)

commit_message:
Add option to control flavor management

This introduces the new option to control whether flavors should be
managed, which are similar to the existing control_* options . Flavor
management is skipped if nova is marked unavailable.

Change-Id: I689e6f3a029e33cfb7cdeee99cc7e5305df20088

commit_message:
Add option to skip loading agent Trunk extension

On OVS agent, Trunk extension is always loaded. If trunk plugin is not
enabled server side, we don't want to enable extension on agent side.
It will avoid declaration of RPCServer for Trunk and SubPort objects.

Introduce a new option agent side to control loading of trunk extension
    - agent.trunk_enabled set to True as default

Closes-bug: #2058712
Change-Id: I94602d5f3159d9a2d5b988c9ab6cdd20dfd4af5b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/79/913979/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: def notify_init_event(agent_type, agent): registry.publish(agent_type, events.AFTER_INIT, agent)

commit_message:
Support encrypted backing files for qcow2

This is the first part for adding support of encrypted backing files.
It is focused on tracking backing file secrets in BDMs and making
image rebase and image convert work with encrypted backing files.

A following patch will add support for encrypted source images (which
will be used to create encrypted backing files).

Related to blueprint ephemeral-encryption-libvirt

Change-Id: Ief348c2555436ad4764438de1931a0489e1276b7

commit_message:
Add keymaster middleware

Add support for configuring swift-proxy keymaster middleware. The
keymaster middleware handles keys for swift encryption[1].

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/swift/latest/overview_encryption.html

Change-Id: Ic6c34c5381eb4f57642493b5acf127dba4f7834e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-swift refs/changes/07/920707/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # # Configure Swift Keymaster middleware. # # == Examples # # include swift::proxy::keymaster # # == Parameters # # [*encryption_root_secret*] # Encryption root secret value. # # [*keymaster_config_path*] # Sets the path from which the keymaster config options should be read # class swift::proxy::keymaster ( $encryption_root_secret, $keymaster_config_path = '/etc/swift/keymaster.conf', ) { include swift::deps swift_proxy_config { 'filter:keymaster/use': value => 'egg:swift#keymaster'; 'filter:keymaster/keymaster_config_path': value => $keymaster_config_path; } swift_keymaster_config { 'keymaster/encryption_root_secret': value => $encryption_root_secret; } }

commit_message:
Add backing_encryption_secret_uuid to BlockDeviceMapping

This will be needed to support encrypted backing files for ephemeral
encryption.

Related to blueprint ephemeral-storage-encryption

commit_message:
Add encryption support to qemu-img rebase

This enables rebasing an encrypted image, which will be needed to
support snapshots.

Related to blueprint ephemeral-encryption-libvirt

Change-Id: I2914034511a68f46468f55fc47493fb7d00f2766
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/36/870936/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _rebase_with_qemu_img(source_path, rebase_base, encryption=None): if encryption: with tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile( mode='tr+', encoding='utf-8' ) as f: # Write out the passphrase secret to a temp file f.write(encryption.get('secret')) # Ensure the secret is written to disk, we can't .close() here # as that removes the file when using NamedTemporaryFile f.flush() # Need the secret for the resize. When --image-opts is used, # the source filename must be passed as part of the option # string instead of as a positional arg. encryption_opts = ( '--object', f"secret,id=sec,file={f.name}", '--image-opts', f"encrypt.key-secret=sec,file.filename={source_path}", ) # execute operation with disk concurrency semaphore with compute_utils.disk_ops_semaphore: processutils.execute("qemu-img", "rebase", "-b", backing_file, *qemu_img_extra_arg, *encryption_opts) else: qemu_img_extra_arg.append(source_path) # execute operation with disk concurrency semaphore with compute_utils.disk_ops_semaphore: processutils.execute("qemu-img", "rebase", "-b", backing_file, *qemu_img_extra_arg) encryption = backend.get_encryption(context) self._rebase_with_qemu_img( backend.path, base_backing_fname, encryption=encryption)
deleted_lines: def _rebase_with_qemu_img(source_path, rebase_base): qemu_img_extra_arg.append(source_path) # execute operation with disk concurrency semaphore with compute_utils.disk_ops_semaphore: processutils.execute("qemu-img", "rebase", "-b", backing_file, *qemu_img_extra_arg) self._rebase_with_qemu_img(backend.path, base_backing_fname)

commit_message:
[WIP] Add initial mypy tooling for type annotations

FIXME: update this commit message
In the last PTG meeting we have decided to try enabling
type checking in our codebase. Neutron-lib was chosen as
a good candidate to try this out.

Change-Id: If935c4f2281938fb31e11758b7c0f6b504894833
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib refs/changes/57/919757/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [testenv:mypy] commands = mypy --config-file ./mypy.ini

subject: Update base database schema from liberty to mitaka
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2024-02-11 07:59:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/2f687d9a05b9cc2b695be6fea665124934c53dd9', 'message': 'Update base database schema from liberty to mitaka

commit_message:
Update base database schema from liberty to mitaka

This change is based on the manual squash of schema change in mitaka
into the base liberty schema.

Change-Id: Ic723943a6d0a1c3efa99ce77adef05b00d565c04

commit_message:
Stable changes for stable/2024.1 (caracal) branch

This patch converts stable/2024.1 into a stable maintenance branch. It:

- modifies .gitreview to point to stable/2024.1
- switches (test-)requirements*.txt -> (test-)requirements*.in
  for pip-compile usage.
- creates (test-)requirements-py*.txt from *.in using pip-compile for
  the relevant python version.
- Updates bundles to point to ceph/edge and 24.04/edge for ceph and
  OVN charms.
- Adds build.lock file to the reactive charms.
- Syncs charm-helpers for classic charms.
- Locks requirements.txt from requirements.in for ops machine charms.
- Locks charms.openstack, zaza, zaza-openstack-tests, charm-helpers to
  stable branches.

Change-Id: I0f83bd251257713e62d537e9081f03ce0e0c7e24

commit_message:
Handle neutron-client conflict

When user tries to add stateless and stateful security
groups on same port, neutron raises SecurityGroupConflict (409),
but nova doesnot handle it and raises InternalServerError (500).

As it appears to be invalid operation from user, so user should get
the message that they are doing wrong.

This changes catches SecurityGroupConflict from neutron
client and raises newly added nova exception
SecurityGroupConnectionStateConflict with 409 error code.

Closes-Bug: #2056195
Change-Id: Ifad28fdd536ff0a4b30e786b2fcbc5a55987a13a

commit_message:
Support encrypted source images for qcow2

This is separated out from the "create" patch to 1) reduce the size of
the patch and 2) initially in the series we aren't supporting encrypted
source images, so they don't need to be or shouldn't be in the first
"create" patch.

TODO: Block encrypted source images in the API? I'm thinking not
because we're not letting snapshots happen for encrypted disks yet so
it may be safe to assume we're not going to get any requests to create
from an encrypted source image.

Related to blueprint ephemeral-storage-encryption

Change-Id: I1824aafc615e488d9caee460221ae0eb2bd670e7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/92/919992/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import typing as tyfrom nova import objectsclass EncryptionOptions(ty.TypedDict): secret: str format: str def fetch_to_flat( context: 'nova.context.RequestContext', image_href: str, path: str, trusted_certs: ty.Optional['objects.TrustedCerts'] = None, src_encryption: ty.Optional[EncryptionOptions] = None, dest_encryption: ty.Optional[EncryptionOptions] = None ) -> None: """Fetch an image and convert it to a flat format if needed. This function is usually used to fetch backing/base images and the disk file format of the target image depends on whether or not dest_encryption has been specified. If dest_encryption has not been specified and the source image is 'qcow2', the target image format should be 'raw'. If dest_encryption has been specified and the source image is 'qcow2', the target image format should be 'luks' (the QEMU disk file format name for raw encrypted) [1]. If dest_encryption has not been specified and the source image is 'raw', this function is a no-op. If dest_encryption has been specified and the source image is 'luks', this function is a no-op. [1] https://www.qemu.org/docs/master/system/qemu-block-drivers.html """ if fmt not in ("raw", "luks") and CONF.force_raw_images: dest_fmt = 'raw' if not dest_encryption else 'luks' LOG.debug("%s was %s, converting to %s", image_href, fmt, dest_fmt) convert_image( path_tmp, staged, fmt, dest_fmt, src_encryption=src_encryption, dest_encryption=dest_encryption) reason=_( "Unable to convert image to %(dest_fmt)s: %(exp)s") % {'dest_fmt': dest_fmt, 'exp': exp}) if data.file_format not in ("raw", "luks"): reason=_("Converted to %s, but format is now %s") % (dest_fmt, data.file_format))
deleted_lines: def fetch_to_raw(context, image_href, path, trusted_certs=None): if fmt != "raw" and CONF.force_raw_images: LOG.debug("%s was %s, converting to raw", image_href, fmt) convert_image(path_tmp, staged, fmt, 'raw') reason=_("Unable to convert image to raw: %(exp)s") % {'exp': exp}) if data.file_format != "raw": reason=_("Converted to raw, but format is now %s") % data.file_format)

'}, {'number': 13, 'created': '2023-07-28 04:21:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/c81267babdd54bbd78161b6863009c1ed1a2103b', 'message': "Support rebuild and unshelve with ephemeral encryption

When an instance is created with ephemeral encryption specified, the
image properties related to the encryption (if present) are taken from
the image and then stored in the instance system metadata. This
includes the secret UUID needed to read the image.

When an instance is snaphotted or shelved, the created image will have
a new secret and its UUID will be kept in the created image's image
properties.

If/when the encrypted snapshot image is used later to create a new
instance or unshelve an existing instance, the new image's image
properties including its secret UUID will be needed to create or
unshelve the instance.

This enables ephemeral encryption related image properties to be
refreshed in the instance system metadata when a new image is used
during a rebuild or unshelve.

Related to blueprint ephemeral-storage-encryption

Change-Id: I09113512f9e2cec442ce61ef145a8ea170cf319c

"}, {'number': 27, 'created': '2024-02-02 06:41:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/df90f5efe86b0734698eabdef9a93ec3ba85dc76', 'message': "Support rebuild and unshelve with ephemeral encryption

"}, {'number': 28, 'created': '2024-02-06 08:05:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/e6ec4e253c341028022c544038c1e72d5de760bd', 'message': "Support rebuild and unshelve with ephemeral encryption

When an instance is created with ephemeral encryption specified, the
image properties related to the encryption (if present) are taken from
the image and then stored in the instance system metadata. This
includes the secret UUID needed to read the image.

When an instance is snaphotted or shelved, the created image will have
a new secret and its UUID will be kept in the created image's image
properties.

If/when the encrypted snapshot image is used later to create a new
instance or unshelve an existing instance, the new image's image
properties including its secret UUID will be needed to create or
unshelve the instance.

This enables ephemeral encryption related image properties to be
refreshed in the instance system metadata when a new image is used
during a rebuild or unshelve.

Rebuilds with a new image are allowed to change the instance from using
ephemeral encryption to not using ephemeral encryption via the image
properties, as long as the rebuild request is being made by the user_id
that owns the instance. This is meant to ensure encryption secrets are
always accessible to owner of the instance. Requests from different
users are rejected with HTTP 403.

Related to blueprint ephemeral-storage-encryption

Change-Id: I09113512f9e2cec442ce61ef145a8ea170cf319c
"}, {'number': 29, 'created': '2024-02-06 08:26:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/d411e4bebae2b801b244bf9205995706082f4525', 'message': "Support rebuild and unshelve with ephemeral encryption

the image and then stored in the instance system metadata. This

If/when the encrypted snapshot image is used later to create a new

unshelve the instance.

This enables ephemeral encryption related image properties to be

during a rebuild or unshelve.

Rebuilds with a new image are allowed to change the instance from using
ephemeral encryption to not using ephemeral encryption via the image
properties, as long as the rebuild request is being made by the user_id
that owns the instance. This is meant to ensure encryption secrets are

Related to blueprint ephemeral-storage-encryption

Change-Id: I09113512f9e2cec442ce61ef145a8ea170cf319c
"}, {'number': 30, 'created': '2024-02-08 10:21:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/632d7f42e09f42e01161878ac05c731144f05fb4', 'message': "Support rebuild with ephemeral encryption for qcow2

For rebuilds with a new image, the image properties are validated
against the instance's flavor to ensure there are no conflicts, else a
HTTP 400 is returned.

Rebuilds with a new image are allowed to change the instance from using
ephemeral encryption to not using ephemeral encryption via the image
properties, as long as the rebuild request is being made by the user_id
that owns the instance. This is meant to ensure encryption secrets are
always accessible to owner of the instance. Requests from different
users are rejected with HTTP 403.

Ephemeral encryption attributes in the BDMs are reset during a rebuild
from requesting ephemeral encryption to no ephemeral encryption.

commit_message:
Support rebuild with ephemeral encryption for qcow2

For rebuilds with a new image, the image properties are validated
against the instance's flavor to ensure there are no conflicts, else a
HTTP 400 is returned.

Rebuilds with a new image are allowed to change the instance from using
ephemeral encryption to not using ephemeral encryption via the image
properties, as long as the rebuild request is being made by the user_id
that owns the instance. This is meant to ensure encryption secrets are
always accessible to owner of the instance. Requests from different
users are rejected with HTTP 403.

Ephemeral encryption attributes in the BDMs are reset during a rebuild
from requesting ephemeral encryption to no ephemeral encryption.

Related to blueprint ephemeral-storage-encryption

Change-Id: I09113512f9e2cec442ce61ef145a8ea170cf319c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/39/870939/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # We are potentially changing images, so wipe out the old # encryption attributes in the BDMs and update them with properties # from the new image. We could be going from not encrypted to # encrypted, for example. Note that we have to do this after # calling driver.destroy() because we needed the old encryption # secret UUID in the BDM in order to delete the old secret. self.reset_and_update_ephemeral_encryption_bdms( instance.flavor, image_meta, bdms) @staticmethod def reset_and_update_ephemeral_encryption_bdms(flavor, image_meta, bdms): if bdms: bdms.reset_encryption_fields() compute_utils.update_ephemeral_encryption_bdms( flavor, image_meta, bdms) bdms.save_all() if image: image_meta = objects.ImageMeta.from_dict(image) else: image_meta = objects.ImageMeta.from_dict( utils.get_image_from_system_metadata( instance.system_metadata)) # Update the encryption secret UUID in system metadata with the UUID # from the image, if there is one. key = 'hw_ephemeral_encryption_secret_uuid' if key in image_meta.properties: instance.system_metadata['image_' + key] = ( image_meta.properties.get(key)) # Update encryption fields in the BDMs with values from the image # properties before generating block_device_info. Example: the # encryption secret UUID for the image will be different than the UUID # of the previous image before the instance was shelved. self.reset_and_update_ephemeral_encryption_bdms( instance.flavor, image_meta, bdms) # Save the original image_ref
deleted_lines: image_meta = objects.ImageMeta.from_dict(image) else: image_meta = objects.ImageMeta.from_dict( utils.get_image_from_system_metadata( instance.system_metadata))

commit_message:
Remove logic for nova-network

nova-network was removed several cycles ago and we no longer expect
any users using that removed feature with recent heat.

Change-Id: Ib5a5dbee5caa11a5bee0d9d31235d371cfdba7c7

deleted_lines: def test_is_not_using_neutron_exception(self): snippet = rsrc_defn.ResourceDefinition('aresource', 'GenericResourceType') res = resource.Resource('aresource', snippet, self.stack) mock_create = self.patch( 'heat.engine.clients.os.neutron.NeutronClientPlugin._create') mock_create.side_effect = Exception() self.assertFalse(res.is_using_neutron()) def test_is_using_neutron_endpoint_lookup(self): snippet = rsrc_defn.ResourceDefinition('aresource', 'GenericResourceType') res = resource.Resource('aresource', snippet, self.stack) client = mock.Mock() self.patchobject(client.httpclient, 'get_endpoint', return_value=None) self.patch( 'heat.engine.clients.os.neutron.NeutronClientPlugin._create', return_value=client) self.assertFalse(res.is_using_neutron()) self.patchobject(client.httpclient, 'get_endpoint', return_value=mock.Mock()) self.assertTrue(res.is_using_neutron())

commit_message:
Update readme with Juju 3 compatible commands

Add Juju 3 compatible commands to the README.

Change-Id: I221a2c09d1d56809e3ffe75ac42bae9502389a79
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-mysql-innodb-cluster refs/changes/84/910284/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: For Juju 2.x: For Juju 3.x: juju deploy mysql-router keystone-mysql-router juju integrate keystone-mysql-router:db-router mysql-innodb-cluster:db-router juju integrate keystone-mysql-router:shared-db keystone:shared-db units can be retrieved from the leader unit. This command varies slightly between Juju 2.x and Juju 3.x versions. For Juju 2.x:For Juju 3.x: juju exec --unit mysql-innodb-cluster/leader leader-get mysql.passwd For Juju 2.x: For Juju 3.x: juju integrate mysql-innodb-cluster:certificates vault:certificates For Juju 2.x: For Juju 3.x: juju run --wait mysql-innodb-cluster/leader update-unit-acls juju run --wait mysql-innodb-cluster/leader add-instance address=<address of new unit>
deleted_lines: units can be retrieved using the following command:

commit_message:
Get rid of RequestContext.tenant_id

This additional attribute can be replaced by the built-in project_id
attribute. Switch to the built-in one to reduce implementations
specifically maintained in the heat repo.

Change-Id: I21eda816f8f78e63f1d6b9afae9f0634d026f2c3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/32/921632/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.ctx.project_id = '123' tenant_id=self.ctx.project_id,

deleted_lines: def update_alembic_version(old, new): """Correct alembic head in order to upgrade DB using EMC method. :param:old: Actual alembic head :param:new: Expected alembic head to be updated """ meta = MetaData() alembic_version = Table( 'alembic_version', meta, autoload_with=engine) alembic_version.update().values( version_num=new).where( alembic_version.c.version_num == old).execute() if "pike01" in heads: update_alembic_version("pike01", "pike_contract01") heads = context.get_current_heads()

subject: Add database migration to ALTER encryption_options
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2024-06-08 01:50:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/58598ec493768e1b32e87d224296bb5fcf1a0e4a', 'message': "Add database migration to ALTER encryption_options

The encryption_options column in the block_device_mapping table has
never been used for anything and data has never been written to it.

Now we have need to store encryption details for BDMs such as what
cipher algorithm, cipher mode, hash algorithm, etc were used to encrypt
the data. We may need these details in the future for upgrade migration
purposes.

We agreed that it would not be good to use the existing
encryption_options field on the BlockDeviceMapping object, so instead
we are adding an encryption_details field and raising an exception if
there is an attempt to set the never-to-be-used encryption_options
field.

We plan to store the encryption_details data as a serialized
EncryptDetails JSON blob which could theoretically become large in the
future, so we want to use the TEXT column type to store it.

We could either add a new encryption_details column to the
block_device_mapping table and keep the encryption_options column empty
forever or we could ALTER the column to change its name and data type
to be used for encryption_details. We are trying to do the latter to
avoid carrying an empty column which will never be used.

This adds the encryption_details field to the BlockDeviceMapping object
as an ObjectField('EncryptDetails'), raises an exception if an attempt
is made to set encryption_options, and swaps all of the code over from
encryption_options to encryption_details.

Related to blueprint ephemeral-storage-encryption

Change-Id: Iddbb31fb6c9bef1e7fba3b4dd7c6f5db2e612873

commit_message:
Add database migration to ALTER encryption_options

The encryption_options column in the block_device_mapping table has
never been used for anything and data has never been written to it.

Now we have need to store encryption details for BDMs such as what
cipher algorithm, cipher mode, hash algorithm, etc were used to encrypt
the data. We may need these details in the future for upgrade migration
purposes.

We agreed that it would not be good to use the existing
encryption_options field on the BlockDeviceMapping object, so instead
we are adding an encryption_details field and raising an exception if
there is an attempt to set the never-to-be-used encryption_options
field.

We plan to store the encryption_details data as a serialized
EncryptDetails JSON blob which could theoretically become large in the
future, so we want to use the TEXT column type to store it.

We could either add a new encryption_details column to the
block_device_mapping table and keep the encryption_options column empty
forever or we could ALTER the column to change its name and data type
to be used for encryption_details. We are trying to do the latter to
avoid carrying an empty column which will never be used.

This adds the encryption_details field to the BlockDeviceMapping object
as an ObjectField('EncryptDetails'), raises an exception if an attempt
is made to set encryption_options, and swaps all of the code over from
encryption_options to encryption_details.

Related to blueprint ephemeral-storage-encryption

Change-Id: Iddbb31fb6c9bef1e7fba3b4dd7c6f5db2e612873

commit_message:
Use python 3.10 in unit tests with latest tosca-parser

... because Python 3.7 is no longer tested. Python 3.10 is selected
from the supported runtime versions because it's the default python
version in Ubuntu Jammy.

This also fixes a few problems causing failure in the test.

Change-Id: Ida855a8438fe980998240c5f09cf7826b9ca78dc

commit_message:
Support multiple filters together for volume time comparison filter

Support multiple time comparison filtering together on the
volume "updated_at" and "created_at" fields like
"updated_at=lt:time1, gt:time2".
It means "time2 < volume.updated_time < time1",
there is "AND" relationship with those two operators.

Change-Id: Idde91feaa63aea7806b485ca90147d43e004c608
Closes-bug: #2045994
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/46/740146/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: MULTIPLE_TIME_COMPARISON_FILTER = '3.61'

commit_message:
wip: Use cryptography to manipulate certificates

The documentation of PyOpenSSL[1] recommands using pyca/crytography
instead of OpenSSL.crypto .

[1] https://www.pyopenssl.org/en/latest/api/crypto.html

Change-Id: I0dab4d793df2a9ddd8915799b014a170ecc270c4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/63/906163/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from cryptography import x509 csr = x509.load_pem_x509_csr(csr_pem) pubkey = csr.public_key() pubkey.verify( csr.tbs_certrequest_bytes, csr.signature, hash_algorithm=csr.signature_hash_algorithm)
deleted_lines: from OpenSSL import crypto csr = crypto.load_certificate_request(crypto.FILETYPE_PEM, csr_pem) pubkey = csr.get_pubkey() csr.verify(pubkey)

subject: Config option to allow ICMP echo requests on VIP
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2024-03-04 16:03:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/commit/08cda2c59ace7d5a231feef4a6216662872dd5ab', 'message': 'Config option to allow ICMP echo requests on VIP

This adds the configuration option allow_vip_ping in the [networking]
section to allow ICMP echo request (ping) packets on the VIP. This
option is off by default and can be enabled by an operator to ease
network debugging and transparency.

Closes-Bug: #2055892
Change-Id: I4ff598d6ea577423ce423b25c094e376d7ff6f88
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2024-03-06 17:19:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/commit/f174e3e19b9828442897609954afa403bf8a6a10', 'message': 'Config option to allow ICMP echo requests on VIP

This adds the configuration option allow_vip_ping in the [networking]
section to allow ICMP echo request (ping) packets on the VIP. This
option is off by default and can be enabled by an operator to ease
network debugging and transparency.

Closes-Bug: #2055892
Change-Id: I4ff598d6ea577423ce423b25c094e376d7ff6f88

commit_message:
Config option to allow ICMP echo requests on VIP

This adds the configuration option allow_vip_ping in the [networking]
section to allow ICMP echo request (ping) packets on the VIP. This
option is off by default and can be enabled by an operator to ease
network debugging and transparency.

Closes-Bug: #2055892
Change-Id: I4ff598d6ea577423ce423b25c094e376d7ff6f88
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/63/910963/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | Amphora based load balancers can now be configured to respond to ICMP echo requests (ping) packets. This feature is off by default and can be enabled by setting the allow_vip_ping option in the [networking] section to true.

commit_message:
Set slightly more accurate name for the manage containers role

Follow-up on I43a9c2a57fcfe2c9d84f39903aac7c258f9a897f. As discussed
before we set slightly more accurate name for the manage containers
role since using 'deploy-containers' role with action 'destroy' can
be a little confusing.

Change-Id: I6d4a3479d492e0fe86ce3de7414fa47c584577ea
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>

subject: Support to query snapshot filter by updated_at/created_at
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-06-03 07:50:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/179a98bc7c946267c559048389f396b27decbf02', 'message': 'Support to query snapshot filter by updated_at/created_at

Support users can query resources by specifying the time
that resources are created at or updated at with time
comparison operators: "gt/gte/eq/neq/lt/lte",
and cinder will return all which match the condition.

Cinder has supported volume resource in U cycle, now
it's time for other resources.

Add two filters updated_at and created_at in querying API.
"snapshots/detail?created_at=gt:2016-01-01T01:00:00,lt:2016-12-31T01:00:00"

that resources are created at or updated at with time
comparison operators: "gt/gte/eq/neq/lt/lte",
and cinder will return all which match the condition.

Cinder has supported volume resource in U cycle, now
it's time for other resources.

Add two filters updated_at and created_at in querying API.

commit_message:
Support to query snapshot filter by updated_at/created_at

Support users can query snapshot resources by specifying
the time that snapshots are created at or updated at with
time comparison operators: "gt/gte/eq/neq/lt/lte",
and cinder will return all which match the condition.

Cinder has supported volume resources,
it's time for other resources.

Add two filters updated_at and created_at in querying API.
"snapshots/detail?created_at=gt:2016-01-01T01:00:00,lt:2016-12-31T01:00:00"

Change-Id: I36da4f9b7afca755ae0524f2c5a3af810ce4052a
Implements: blueprint support-to-query-snapshot-filter-by-updated-at-created-at
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/62/733062/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: SNAPSHOT_TIME_COMPARISON_FILTER = '3.61'

subject: Create independent mount path for each device
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2024-05-20 09:52:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/cdd06557792d08dec746d2c69585ed8003b2d7b4', 'message': 'Create independent mount path for each device

Currently the single mount path is used for all volume devices, but
this sometimes causes mount to fail because of resource busy. Create
an independent mount path per device to avoid such timing problems.

commit_message:
Create independent mount path for each device

Currently the single mount path is used for all volume devices, but
this sometimes causes mount to fail because of resource busy. Create
an independent mount path per device to avoid such timing problems.

Change-Id: Ida4381f28fc528ca83b0818aec6c7633112d19fa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/21/920021/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Test remote address groups with additional FW drivers

Like IptablesFirewallDriver and OVSHybridIptablesFirewallDriver.
Previously, this test was only executed for OVSFirewallDriver,
which caused us to miss bug #2058138, where remote address groups
did not work correctly with all firewall drivers.

Note that this test will fail, until the Neutron fix for #2058138
is merged.

Also this commit fixes an issue with false positive test results,
whereas the test makes changes to Address Groups, but doesn't leave
enough time betwen change and check for the issue to appear.

Both improvements combined reliably detect #2058138.

Related-Bug: #2058138
Change-Id: Id1fa2489170d5cdaebf72c6d3b00818d9fb118fe

commit_message:
Refactor the use of include_vars

Move remaining os-default files to vars directory, where the
include_vars expects them to be.

Use a first_found lookup instead of a with_first_found loop so that
the 'paths' parameter can be used.

This ensures that only vars from the role are included, and not vars
from a parent calling role. This can happen when a parent role has
a higher priority vars file available for inclusion than the role
it calls.

Change-Id: I49c041b2217c51048fa182106009d334b6b38f6f

commit_message:
Add functions to srbac base file

Reason:
There are multiple patches that contains the same file and code.
Now, we will remove all the code from the other patches and rebase on
this patch.

Change-Id: I4d5b4f5a212a587cc744874334502adb7179fd2a
Signed-off-by: ybenshim <ybenshim@redhat.com>

added_lines: def create_volume(self, client, volume_type=None, metadata=None, **kwargs): volume_type: Volume type object if volume_type: kwargs['volume_type'] = volume_type kwargs['metadata'] = metadata """Wrapper utility that returns a test backup Args: volume_id: id of the volume to be backed-up backup_client: Backup client object add_cleanup: If should cleanup the resource on teardown Returns: backup: The new backup object """ @classmethod def create_group( cls, volume_type, group_type, groups_client, delete_volumes=False ): """Wrapper utility that creates group Args: volume_type: volume-type object group_type: group_type object groups_client: groups_client client object delete_volumes: Boolean if should delete the volumes associated with the group Returns: group: The new group object """ group_name = data_utils.rand_name( cls.__class__.__name__ + '-Group') group = groups_client.create_group( name=group_name, group_type=group_type['id'], volume_types=[volume_type['id']] )['group'] waiters.wait_for_volume_resource_status( groups_client, group['id'], 'available' ) cls.addClassResourceCleanup( test_utils.call_and_ignore_notfound_exc, groups_client.wait_for_resource_deletion, group['id'] ) cls.addClassResourceCleanup( test_utils.call_and_ignore_notfound_exc, groups_client.delete_group, group['id'], delete_volumes=delete_volumes ) return group @staticmethod def add_volume_to_group( groups_client, group_id, volumes_client, volume_id ): """Wrapper utility that adds a volume to a group Args: groups_client: groups_client client object group_id: the id of the group volumes_client: volumes_client client object volume_id: the id of the volume """ groups_client.update_group( group_id=group_id, add_volumes=volume_id ) waiters.wait_for_volume_resource_status( volumes_client, volume_id, 'available' ) waiters.wait_for_volume_resource_status( groups_client, group_id, 'available' ) @classmethod def create_volume_type(cls, name=None, volume_types_client=None, **kwargs): """Wrapper utility that returns a test volume-type. Args: name: Name of the volume-type volume_types_client: Client object Returns: Volume-type object """ name = name or data_utils.rand_name(cls.__name__ + '-volume-type') volume_type = cls.volume_types_client.create_volume_type( name=name, **kwargs)['volume_type'] cls.addClassResourceCleanup( test_utils.call_and_ignore_notfound_exc, volume_types_client.wait_for_resource_deletion, volume_type['id'] ) cls.addClassResourceCleanup( test_utils.call_and_ignore_notfound_exc, volume_types_client.delete_volume_type, volume_type_id=volume_type['id'] ) return volume_type @classmethod def create_group_type(cls, client, cleanup=True): """Wrapper utility that returns a test group-type. Args: client: the group_client client object cleanup: boolean if should run cleanup on teardown Returns: group-type object """ name = data_utils.rand_name(cls.__class__.__name__ + '-group-type') description = data_utils.rand_name("group-type-description") group_specs = { "consistent_group_snapshot_enabled": "<is> False", "key1": "value1", "key2": "value2" } params = {'name': name, 'description': description, 'group_specs': group_specs, 'is_public': True} group_type = client.create_group_type(**params)['group_type'] if cleanup: cls.addClassResourceCleanup( test_utils.call_and_ignore_notfound_exc, client.delete_group_type, group_type['id'] ) return group_type @classmethod def create_group_snapshot(cls, client, group_id, **kwargs): """Wrapper utility that creates a group-snapshot. Args: client: the group-snapshot client object group_id: the id of the group Returns: group-snapshot object """ kwargs['name'] = data_utils.rand_name( cls.__class__.__name__ + '-Group_Snapshot' ) kwargs['group_id'] = group_id group_snapshot = client.create_group_snapshot( **kwargs )['group_snapshot'] group_snapshot['group_id'] = kwargs['group_id'] cls.addClassResourceCleanup( test_utils.call_and_ignore_notfound_exc, client.wait_for_resource_deletion, group_snapshot['id'] ) cls.addClassResourceCleanup( test_utils.call_and_ignore_notfound_exc, client.delete_group_snapshot, group_snapshot['id'] ) waiters.wait_for_volume_resource_status( client, group_snapshot['id'], 'available' ) return group_snapshot @classmethod def create_qos_specs(cls, client=None, cleanup=True, **kwargs): """Wrapper utility that returns a test QOS-specs. Args: client: QOS specs client object cleanup: True if should delete the QOS, False otherwise Returns: QOS-specs object """ qos_name = data_utils.rand_name(cls.__name__ + '-qos-specs') qos_specs = client.create_qos(name=qos_name, **kwargs)['qos_specs'] if cleanup: cls.addClassResourceCleanup( test_utils.call_and_ignore_notfound_exc, client.wait_for_resource_deletion, qos_specs['id'] ) cls.addClassResourceCleanup( test_utils.call_and_ignore_notfound_exc, client.delete_qos, qos_id=qos_specs['id'] ) return qos_specs @classmethod def create_server(cls, client=None, wait_until='ACTIVE', **kwargs): """Wrapper utility that returns a test server. Args: client: Client object wait_until: Status to wait for Returns: ID of the created server """ name = kwargs.pop( 'name', data_utils.rand_name(cls.__class__.__name__ + '-instance')) tenant_network = cls.get_tenant_network() server, _ = compute.create_test_server( client, tenant_network=tenant_network, name=name, wait_until=wait_until, **kwargs) cls.addClassResourceCleanup( test_utils.call_and_ignore_notfound_exc, waiters.wait_for_server_termination, client=cls.server_client, server_id=server['id'] ) cls.addClassResourceCleanup( test_utils.call_and_ignore_notfound_exc, cls.server_client.delete_server, server_id=server['id'] ) return server['id']

commit_message:
Add TOSCA v1.3 to valid template version

This patch adds TOSCA v1.3 to valid template version to enable parsing
of TOSCA v1.3 template files.
Note that this patch only adds TOSCA v1.3 to a valid version and does
not compliant to changes made in TOSCA v1.3.

Change-Id: I6e2820a12fe146f32022350c65893ed660f8e643

commit_message:
Time comparison filter didn't support time zone offset

Cinder has supported to filter volumes by
time comparison operators. The time format is following
the ISO 8601. But there is small bug that didn't consider
the time zone offset well in time string.
That will impact the result of filtering volumes.

Change-Id: I51ee7d6d07561157ee764f73520c9f6f7c25eca0
Closes-bug: #1882622

subject: Revert "[OVN] Prevent Trunk creation/deletion with parent port bound"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2024-06-08 16:52:51.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_dvr_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/services/trunk/test_plugin.py', 'neutron/db/l3_dvr_db.py', 'releasenotes/notes/ovn-trunk-check-parent-port-eeca2eceaca9d158.yaml', 'neutron/services/trunk/drivers/ovn/trunk_driver.py', 'neutron/common/utils.py', 'neutron/services/trunk/plugin.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/services/trunk/drivers/ovn/test_trunk_driver.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/486f3e712fa07578275edbc0b0fa48c9560e0398', 'message': 'Revert "[OVN] Prevent Trunk creation/deletion with parent port bound"

There are three reasons to revert this patch.

1. It broke RPC push API for trunks because it added port db model to
   event payload that is not serializeable.

2. It also broke the callback event payload interface, which requires
   that all entries in .states attribute belong to the same core object.

To quote from neutron-lib,

```
 # an iterable of states for the resource from the newest to the oldest
 # for example db states or api request/response
 # the actual object type for states will vary depending on event caller
 self.states = ...
```

3. There is no good justification why ml2/ovn would not allow this
   operation. The rationale for the original patch was to align the
   behavior with ml2/ovs, but we don't such parity requirements. The 409
   error that can be returned by the API endpoints is backend specific.

To quote api-ref,

```
409 The operation returns this error code for one of these reasons:
    A system configuration prevents the operation from succeeding.
```

AFAIU there is nothing that prevents ml2/ovn to create a trunk in this
situation.

This will have to be backported in all supported branches (the original
patch was backported down to Wallaby).

Conflicts:
	neutron/services/trunk/drivers/ovn/trunk_driver.py
	neutron/common/utils.py
	neutron/db/l3_dvr_db.py

This reverts commit 833a6d82cd705548130cdac73a88d388f52c7824.

Closes-Bug: #2065707
Related-Bug: #2022059
